page.title: 04MARSTON MAGNA WINERY.
page.content: The winery was opened in 1960.It is part of a large and profitable company manufacturing six different varieties of British wine and producing between 150,000 and 300,000 litres a week and in a year 10,000000 litres on average. Concentrated grape juice is imported from Greece,Cyprus,Italy and Spain. The juice is mixed with water and sugar to ferment.The liquid is then passed through filters to purifiy it and make it crystal clear.Samples are taken and sent to the laboratory to be tested for alcohol content, sweetness, colour and taste.The wine is stored in vats to mature.Finally it is taken to the Midlands for bottling. The winery has a vat made of English Oak which holds 63,000 gallons and is thought to be the biggest in England. There are 28 people employed at the winery doing the 4 separate processes.
